fields.Title: INVENTORY / MULLEN IDENTITY
fields.Description: "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity". Dick Mullen is mistaken for someone (an identity).

fields.Title: START
input
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The tagline reads: "Detective Dick..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The tagline reads: "Detective Dick Mullen must prove his innocence after an old friend is murdered -- by someone who looks just like Dick Mullen!" That seems to sum up the premise nicely.

fields.Title: suspects hub
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "As the two lovers share a post-coit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: As the two lovers share a post-coital cigarette, Deanna Deneuve turns to Mullen and says, "By the way, Dick, there was something else I meant to tell you..."

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Whatever it is, Mullen never hears..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Whatever it is, Mullen never hears the words -- A blow to the base of his skull knocks him out cold instantly.

fields.Title: Endurance: "Speaking of, *your* gut's seen bett..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Speaking of, *your* gut's seen better days. It's a cesspool of burbling acids and noxious fumes, the kind of thing the government might declare a Zone of Irredeemable Catastrophe.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's the matter, detective?" The..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What's the matter, detective?" The lieutenant turns to you with a start.

fields.Title: You: "Wait -- I've got some questions fir..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait -- I've got some questions first.

fields.Title: You: "Why did Dick Mullen become a detect..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why did Dick Mullen become a detective in the first place?

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "But also extremely *accurate*, in y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But also extremely *accurate*, in your case.

fields.Title: Composure: "Nothing. Forget it. Go back to your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Nothing. Forget it. Go back to your story.

fields.Title: Jump to: [questionhub]
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Whatever you say, *art cop*. The bo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Whatever you say, *art cop*. The book has stopped laughing, but you can feel it grinning smugly at you.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You know you look like a mad man, r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You know you look like a mad man, right? Giving an inanimate object the finger like that.

fields.Title: You: "Hey, fuck you book! (Give the book..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hey, fuck you book! (Give the book the finger.)

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then perhaps you should stop readi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Then perhaps you should stop reading it."

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But you can't stop, can you? You've..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But you can't stop, can you? You've got to find out what happens.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "You haven't. But it's not too late...."
fields.Dialogue Text: You haven't. But it's not too late. You share a bond that's thicker than blood.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dozens of pages scatter across the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dozens of pages scatter across the ground. The last fifth or so of the book seems to have been lost. It's possible that you could gather and reassemble the pages, but it would take way too long.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The cover features a pastiche of di..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The cover features a pastiche of different scenes. In the foreground, a man in a dark overcoat clutches a pistol to his chest. Rising up behind him are two silhouettes wrapped in a passionate embrace.

fields.Title: IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
Inland Empire: "Are you s-s-sure about that? Someth..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Are you s-s-sure about that? Something about her gives you a *bad* feeling. What kind of *secret* is she hiding?

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Yes, comfort and pleasure. The warm..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, comfort and pleasure. The warmth of another human's touch, the burning taste of liquor on her full, sweet lips...

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "STOP. Don't say it!"
fields.Dialogue Text: STOP. Don't say it!

fields.Title: You: "Finish the book."
fields.Dialogue Text: Finish the book.

fields.Title: You: "You know what? I don't even care. (..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You know what? I don't even care. (Close the book.)

fields.Title: IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
You: "Communism killed them."
fields.Dialogue Text: Communism killed them.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "In your hand, you hold four-fifths..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In your hand, you hold four-fifths of "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity."

fields.Title: You: "I don't need to read this. I'm alre..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't need to read this. I'm already living it. (Close the book.)

fields.Title: Jump to: [inventory.mullen_ripped]
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Outwardly, the old police captain i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Outwardly, the old police captain is a real law-and-order crypto-fascist, a barrel-chested man who's beaten his share of suspects to pulp. But he's also dirty, and increasingly paranoid that someone's going to expose his role in the drug ring...

fields.Title: You: "Nice. Get it, Mullen."
fields.Dialogue Text: Nice. Get it, Mullen.

fields.Title: Authority: "Dick Mullen won't be sent to the cl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dick Mullen won't be sent to the clink for the sake of some *legal niceties*!

fields.Title: You: "The politician's twat son?"
fields.Dialogue Text: The politician's twat son?

fields.Title: You: "No one. You gotta go with your gut."
fields.Dialogue Text: No one. You gotta go with your gut.

fields.Title: Endurance: "No point in worrying about it just..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No point in worrying about it just now. Why don't you get back to the story?

fields.Title: You: "I don't have any more questions. I'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't have any more questions. I've figured it all out.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.mullen_comp_dame"]  and  Variable["inventory.mullen_inland_secret"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_comp_dame"]  and  Variable["inventory.mullen_inland_secret"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_comp_dame"]  and  Variable["inventory.mullen_inland_secret"])
You: "Was I *not* born to be a detective?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Was I *not* born to be a detective?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "For a moment, you cease to read the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: For a moment, you cease to read the story on the page and see the book for what it is, a collection of brittle, cheaply printed pages, held together by glue made from the hooves of horses...

fields.Title: Logic: "This could go on forever. End it no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This could go on forever. End it now.

fields.Title: Volition: "You're no tiger, though, Harry. You..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're no tiger, though, Harry. You're a man. It's your curse to have to choose.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "It's true in more ways than you kno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's true in more ways than you know.

fields.Title: You: "I'm not sure I'm happy with this, b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm not sure I'm happy with this, but maybe the story will turn it around.

fields.Title: You: "Okay, let's get on with the story."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, let's get on with the story.

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "Whatever you say, Detective Hyperop..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Whatever you say, Detective Hyperopia. Why don't you get back to the story?

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "When was the last time *you* ravish..."
fields.Dialogue Text: When was the last time *you* ravished a dame, detective? Besides your crusty old sock, that is.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "It's a dangerous line of work, but..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's a dangerous line of work, but somebody has to do it. That's why Dick Mullen never lets anyone get *too* close...

fields.Title: Half Light: "What's the matter? Afraid you've be..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What's the matter? Afraid you've been hacking up your friends' bodies in the night?

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.mullen_halflight_hacking"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_halflight_hacking"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_halflight_hacking"])

IsKimHere()

Variable["inventory.mullen_ripped"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_ripped"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_ripped"])
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, yes. The problem with mass mar..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ah, yes. The problem with mass market paperbacks... They're not made to last..."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Perhaps this is a sign that you sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Perhaps this is a sign that you should get back to solving your own murder, eh, detective?"

fields.Title: You: "Because I need to solve this case...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Because I need to solve this case. Not for anyone else's sake. For me.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "She's any man's kind of woman, acco..."
fields.Dialogue Text: She's any man's kind of woman, according to this book.

fields.Title: Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_confessed"]  or  Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_kept"]
Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_confessed"]  or  Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_kept"]
!(Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_confessed"]  or  Variable["whirling.kim_mysterious_kept"])
Inland Empire: "You *are* the murderer, after all....."
fields.Dialogue Text: You *are* the murderer, after all...

fields.Title: IsExterior()
IsExterior()
!(IsExterior())
You: "Yep, it's pretty fucking evil."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yep, it's pretty fucking evil.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.mullen_electro_booze"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_electro_booze"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_electro_booze"])
You: "What was that about an art collecto..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What was that about an art collector?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That said, Torvald and Spillane hav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That said, Torvald and Spillane have a long history, and while interrogating him, Mullen discovers that Torvald was once *involved* with Deanna Deneuve. Could it be that this is all over a sordid *love triangle*?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Torvald the Art Collector is a stru..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Torvald the Art Collector is a strung-out mess. Frankly, it's hard to imagine him holding a pistol steady enough to actually hit someone, let alone plug them three times in the chest the way old Spillane got did...

fields.Title: You: "No way. I'm no binoclard."
fields.Dialogue Text: No way. I'm no binoclard.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's exactly what Dick Mullen say..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's exactly what Dick Mullen says in "Dauntless Dick and the Fatal Appointment."

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Are you, though?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Are you, though?

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Have you gone over everyone? Is any..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Have you gone over everyone? Is anybody missing?

fields.Title: You: "I might. I just need to find them."
fields.Dialogue Text: I might. I just need to find them.

fields.Title: Jump to: [questionhub]
You: "[Put the book away.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: Modus: Mullen.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.mullen_esprit_about_covering_up"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_esprit_about_covering_up"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_esprit_about_covering_up"])
Jump to: [inventory.mullen_ripped]
Esprit de Corps: "Needless to say, it violates nearly..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Needless to say, it violates nearly every RCM regulation for a detective to investigate a murder in which he is a suspect.

fields.Title: You: ""Gah! Now I'll never know!""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Gah! Now I'll never know!"

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What is it, detective?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What is it, detective?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "If you insist. But again, it's real..."
fields.Dialogue Text: If you insist. But again, it's really pointless...

fields.Title: You: "Okay, whatever, this is getting rid..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, whatever, this is getting ridiculous. (Close the book.)

fields.Title: You: "Because I'm too chickenshit to do a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Because I'm too chickenshit to do anything about it.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "You haven't. But it's not too late...."
fields.Dialogue Text: You haven't. But it's not too late. You share a bond that's thicker than blood.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?

fields.Title: You: ""I'm looking for advice on being a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm looking for advice on being a real detective."

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Deneuve reveals that she was Spilla..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Deneuve reveals that she was Spillane's lover, and that he was mixed up with a local amphetamine smuggling operation. As soon as Mullen begins pulling at strings, the whole conspiracy begins to unravel...

fields.Title: Authority: "That's just Dick Mullen's *modus op..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's just Dick Mullen's *modus operandi*. He might bend the rules, but he closes cases no one else can.

fields.Title: You: "Double fuck!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Double fuck!

fields.Title: You: "The dirty police captain?"
fields.Dialogue Text: The dirty police captain?

fields.Title: You: "Uh... Dick Mullen?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Uh... Dick Mullen?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Who can you trust in this wicked, m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Who can you trust in this wicked, messed-up world?

fields.Title: You: "Your partner. (Look at Kim.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: Your partner. (Look at Kim.)

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.mullen_endurance_gut"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_endurance_gut"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_endurance_gut"])
You: "Hey, I'm trying at least."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hey, I'm trying at least.

fields.Title: You: "But why is he like that?"
fields.Dialogue Text: But why is he like that?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What makes you think this isn't *th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What makes you think this isn't *the final Dick Mullen case*?

fields.Title: You: "I... don't know."
fields.Dialogue Text: I... don't know.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Just make sure you don't lose him...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just make sure you don't lose him. You'll not find another like him...

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But then what does this book know?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But then what does this book know? It's just a poorly made piece of pulp garbage, made to be consumed and discarded.

fields.Title: You: "Uh, I'll think about it. Better get..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Uh, I'll think about it. Better get on with the story first.

fields.Title: You: ""I really need to know who this Dic..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I really need to know who this Dick Mullen guy is."

fields.Title: Perception (Sight): "Unfortunately, *your* eyes might no..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Unfortunately, *your* eyes might not be up to the task. Speaking of... should you maybe consider getting corrective lenses? Your nose is like two centimetres from the page.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Can you solve the case before the c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Can you solve the case before the cops close in?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's probably for the best. Thos..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That's probably for the best. Those books aren't exactly famed for their tight plotting."

fields.Title: Jump to: [mullenhub]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""Too bad, detective. If it's any co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Too bad, detective. If it's any consolation, the resolution is almost never very satisfying..."

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "How do you know this isn't the *fin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How do you know this isn't the *final* final case?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Yes, blame a dead horse for your fa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, blame a dead horse for your fat, clumsy fingers.

fields.Title: Jump to: [questionhub]
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "*Art*? You think contemplating *art..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *Art*? You think contemplating *art* is going to save you?

fields.Title: You: "Yeah, I do. I'm the god damn art co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yeah, I do. I'm the god damn art cop, after all.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You haven't been treating the lieut..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You haven't been treating the lieutenant much like a friend, though, have you?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Desperate to clear his name, Mullen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Desperate to clear his name, Mullen manages to convince the Vesper police to release him for *three days* so that Mullen may solve his friend's murder and prove his innocence.

fields.Title: You: "Nice, a dame."
fields.Dialogue Text: Nice, a dame.

fields.Title: You: "Fuck."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fuck.

fields.Title: Endurance: "Could it be an underlying condition..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Could it be an underlying condition aggravated by years of greasy meals scarfed down between shifts? Or the litres upon litres of hard liquor guzzled on an empty stomach?

fields.Title: You: "I've figured it out."
fields.Dialogue Text: I've figured it out.

fields.Title: You: "I just want to relive the experienc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I just want to relive the experience.

fields.Title: You: "Because I don't want to let Kim dow..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Because I don't want to let Kim down.

fields.Title: You: "I've got Kim."
fields.Dialogue Text: I've got Kim.

fields.Title: You: ""This book is making fun of my sinc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This book is making fun of my sincerest beliefs."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you really reading that, detec..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Are you really reading that, detective?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good luck finding it. He's not muc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good luck finding it. He's not much of a character, I think you'll find. Just a stand-in for the reader."

fields.Title: Half Light: "The name of the true killer?"
fields.Dialogue Text: The name of the true killer?

fields.Title: Hand/Eye Coordination: ""Always aim for the centre of mass"..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Always aim for the centre of mass"?

fields.Title: IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
You: "Why bother solving crimes when the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why bother solving crimes when the world is so evil?

Variable["inventory.mullen_esprit_stereotype"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_esprit_stereotype"])
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Could be. Who knows? Only one way t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Could be. Who knows? Only one way to find out.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Do you even *have* those?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Do you even *have* those?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You haven't been treating the lieut..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You haven't been treating the lieutenant much like a friend, though, have you?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Now go on, find out who *really* di..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Now go on, find out who *really* did it.

fields.Title: SubstanceUsedMore("alcohol")
SubstanceUsedMore("alcohol")
!(SubstanceUsedMore("alcohol"))
You: "The sweet taste of a good cigarette..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The sweet taste of a good cigarette, which I still need to find.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "In your hand, you hold "Dick Mullen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: In your hand, you hold "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity." The brittle paperback feels fragile to the touch.

fields.Title: mullenhub
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "A typical privileged twat. In all l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A typical privileged twat. In all likelihood, he's just in over his head. He does bear a personal grudge against Spillane though, a former prosecutor who nearly brought down his father's administration...

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The kid doesn't exactly have Dick M..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The kid doesn't exactly have Dick Mullen's manly build, but he is the correct height, and while interrogating him at his home, Mullen *did* notice a certain overcoat that looks suspiciously like his own...

fields.Title: Jump to: [suspects hub]
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Mullen trashes his blood-stained cl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Mullen trashes his blood-stained clothes and flees the hostel, knowing it's only a matter of hours before the cops discover Deneuve's body, if they haven't been tipped off already...

fields.Title: You: "The junkie art collector?"
fields.Dialogue Text: The junkie art collector?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a quizzica..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant gives you a quizzical expression in return. You go back to the story...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shrugs, resigned to..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant shrugs, resigned to the idea that his profession will rarely, if ever, be accurately represented in art and literature.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Is it really so evil, detective?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Is it really so evil, detective?

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And on that note, perhaps we shoul..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "And on that note, perhaps we should get back to making sense of our own case?"

You: "The smooth taste of some ultra-high..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The smooth taste of some ultra-high-proof booze.

fields.Title: Jump to: [inventory.mullen_ripped]

fields.Dialogue Text: "Stupid old horse glue."

Variable["inventory.mullen_ripped"]

Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Spillane needs Mullen to drive him..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Spillane needs Mullen to drive him in from Vesper to a small town along the Insulindian coast. Despite his friend's apparent agitation, Mullen does as he's asked, then returns home where he passes out drunk, as he does most nights...

fields.Title: You: "Look, I can't judge."
fields.Dialogue Text: Look, I can't judge.

fields.Title: You: ""The cops release their prime murde..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The cops release their prime murder suspect so he can find 'the real killer'? Are you shitting me?"

fields.Title: You: "Man, who doesn't?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Man, who doesn't?

fields.Title: You: "Sounds like my kind of woman."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sounds like my kind of woman.

fields.Title: Physical Instrument: "From nowhere, you hear the screech..."
fields.Dialogue Text: From nowhere, you hear the screech of sneakers on a waxed floor, and you feel the burn of rope against your hands. Are these figments of some other life?

fields.Title: You: "Okay, maybe not. There are parts wo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, maybe not. There are parts worth saving.

IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())

Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Just make sure you don't lose him...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Just make sure you don't lose him. You'll not find another like him...

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...

Variable["TASK.find_smokes"]
Variable["TASK.find_smokes"]
!(Variable["TASK.find_smokes"])
You: "Examine the cover."
fields.Dialogue Text: Examine the cover.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The story opens with a knock at the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The story opens with a knock at the door. Detective Dick Mullen is greeted by an old friend, Charlie Spillane, who's come to Mullen to ask a favour on this dark and cold night...

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "An extremely unprofessional and *hu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: An extremely unprofessional and *hurtful* stereotype that's offensive to all upstanding officers of the law.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dick Mullen was made to crack skull..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dick Mullen was made to crack skulls and solve cases. It's who he is. He could no more stop being a detective than a tiger could cease to be a predator in the night.

fields.Title: Jump to: [inventory.mullen_ripped]
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "But then what does this book know?..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But then what does this book know? It's just a poorly made piece of pulp garbage, made to be consumed and discarded.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "It's true in more ways than you kno..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's true in more ways than you know.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Give it time. You'll fall off the w..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Give it time. You'll fall off the wagon sooner or later.

fields.Title: You: "Your partner. Kim will be there for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your partner. Kim will be there for me.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Heed the bottle's call.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Baby, get some of that sweet speed or spooky pyrholidon... it's the good stuff.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What? That doesn't even make sense...."
fields.Dialogue Text: What? That doesn't even make sense. There's never a straight answer with you, is there? You just get hooked on random stupid notions and then repeat them every chance you get.

fields.Title: Jump to: [mullenhub]
You: "Tell me about the corrupt police ca..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Tell me about the corrupt police captain.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: ""I love you"?"
fields.Dialogue Text: "I love you"?

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Fleeing a crime scene, destroying e..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fleeing a crime scene, destroying evidence... Even if Detective Mullen *didn't* commit the murder, he should be facing *years* behind bars.

fields.Title: You: ""I don't know who's writing this sh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't know who's writing this shit, but I get the feeling they aren't experts on homicide investigations."

fields.Title: You: "Good, evil, it makes no difference...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Good, evil, it makes no difference. These are the end times we're living in.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Have you been paying attention *at..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Have you been paying attention *at all*? It wasn't Mullen! It. Was. An. Imposter. Now go on, find out who *really* did it.

fields.Title: You: "Guess that's it, then. (Close the b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Guess that's it, then. (Close the book.)

fields.Title: You: "Isn't there already a book called "..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Isn't there already a book called "Dick Mullen and the Final Case" or something?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Like what?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Like what?

fields.Title: You: "I did, but I lost them."
fields.Dialogue Text: I did, but I lost them.

fields.Title: You: "The pleasure of contemplating art!"
fields.Dialogue Text: The pleasure of contemplating art!

fields.Title: fixthingshubnokim
Variable["inventory.mullen_electro_drugs"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_electro_drugs"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_electro_drugs"])
You: "Love did them in."
fields.Dialogue Text: Love did them in.

fields.Title: You: ""I'm just skimming it.""
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm just skimming it."

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, you won't find it in *there*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well, you won't find it in *there*. Those books are much more about ravishing dames and gun play than real policework."

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Two days later, Mullen is arrested..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Two days later, Mullen is arrested by the Vesper police and charged with the murder of Charlie Spillane. At his interrogation, Mullen learns that Charlie Spillane was shot in a bar in the very town Mullen dropped him off in, by a man matching *Mullen's* description...

fields.Title: You: "No way Mullen did it. (Keep reading..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No way Mullen did it. (Keep reading.)

fields.Title: Volition: "Your secrets are unknown even unto..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Your secrets are unknown even unto you, so does that make you a rich man or a beggar?

fields.Title: Composure: "You couldn't handle a woman like th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You couldn't handle a woman like that. Look at yourself. You couldn't even handle your --

fields.Title: Jump to: [inventory.mullen_ripped]
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "One evening, Deanna Deneuve comes t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: One evening, Deanna Deneuve comes to Mullen's hostel room in tears. The two of them drink half a bottle of vodka, and soon they're seeking comfort in each other's arms...

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "Well, *that* testimony won't be adm..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Well, *that* testimony won't be admissible any longer.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "When Mullen comes to, Deneuve is de..."
fields.Dialogue Text: When Mullen comes to, Deneuve is dead on the hostel bed next to him. To make matters worse, his clothes are covered with her blood!

fields.Title: You: "Why does everyone close to Dick Mul..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why does everyone close to Dick Mullen wind up dead?

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "It sounds like you're in for a long..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It sounds like you're in for a long, hard road, detective...

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? Rip some sweet cigs instead!

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "He would certainly have the motive..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He would certainly have the motive and the means, but the captain walks with a noticeable *limp* from an old war injury. Is it possible he was able to conceal it long enough to commit the murder?

fields.Title: You: "How does Mullen expect to solve the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: How does Mullen expect to solve the murder if he's sleeping with witnesses!

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "The heat is on! If Dick Mullen can'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The heat is on! If Dick Mullen can't solve both murders before the cops catch up to him, he's going away for life...

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Then why are you still here?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Then why are you still here?

fields.Title: You: "Friends and family."
fields.Dialogue Text: Friends and family.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "What's a *book* know about real ple..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What's a *book* know about real pleasure? What's better than feeling your mesolimbic pathway flood your mind-crevices with *pure* dopamine?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You don't know how you know, but yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You don't know how you know, but you can feel this book *laughing* at you.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Dozens of pages scatter across the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Dozens of pages scatter across the floor. The last fifth or so of the book seems to have been lost. It's possible that you could gather and reassemble the pages, but it would take way too long.

fields.Title: You: "Keep reading."
fields.Dialogue Text: Keep reading.

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "They're not shitting you, detective..."
fields.Dialogue Text: They're not shitting you, detective. This is what the writers think passes for police procedure.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Of *course* Mullen didn't do it. Th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Of *course* Mullen didn't do it. That's the whole premise of the book! Anyway, Mullen returns to the seaside bar where Spillane was murdered, and meets a *beautiful*, *mysterious* woman named Deanna Deneuve.

fields.Title: You: "Now it's getting interesting. (Keep..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Now it's getting interesting. (Keep reading.)

fields.Title: You: "Why is my gut in such bad shape?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Why is my gut in such bad shape?

fields.Title: Drama: "It's much more about the dark and d..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's much more about the dark and deadly atmossssphere.

fields.Title: You: "Unfathomably evil. Death is infinit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Unfathomably evil. Death is infinitely preferable to this torment.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "And you'll never know what happens!..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And you'll never know what happens! Because the rest of the book is gone.

fields.Title: Reaction Speed: "You try to grab the pages as they c..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You try to grab the pages as they come loose but your fingers aren't quick enough... they're gone.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Don't forget, it could have been th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Don't forget, it could have been the *delirium tremens*.

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Why are you even still reading this..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why are you even still reading this garbage? You've got smokes to find!

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "What are you trying to prove, exact..."
fields.Dialogue Text: What are you trying to prove, exactly? And what will change if you *do* manage to prove it?

fields.Title: You: "Okay, so Mullen didn't do it. (Keep..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, so Mullen didn't do it. (Keep reading.)

fields.Title: Esprit de Corps: "The man's a prosecutor's nightmare...."
fields.Dialogue Text: The man's a prosecutor's nightmare. Solving a murder counts for nothing if all the evidence gets thrown out in court over police misconduct.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Will *you* be there for *him*, thou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Will *you* be there for *him*, though, when push comes to shove? Time will tell. In the meantime, let's get on with the story...

fields.Title: You: "I don't really like where this is g..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I don't really like where this is going. (Close the book.)

fields.Title: Jump to: [questionhub]
Conceptualization: "The point is for the reader to feel..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The point is for the reader to feel like *they're* solving the crime along with Dick Mullen. A crude narrative convention, but no less effective for it.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Not only is the local police captai..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not only is the local police captain in on the amphetamine ring, so is the son of a powerful politician, and a strung-out art collector named Torvald. Each of whom has his own reasons for wanting Spillane dead...

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "So who did it, detective? Who kille..."
fields.Dialogue Text: So who did it, detective? Who killed Charlie Spillane and Deanna Deneuve?

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.mullen_perc_glasses"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_perc_glasses"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_perc_glasses"])
Jump to: [Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "When Mullen comes to, Deneuve is de..."]
You: "[Put the book away.]"
fields.Dialogue Text: [Put the book away.]

fields.Title: You: "Don't say what?"
fields.Dialogue Text: Don't say what?

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There was never a time when he wasn..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There was never a time when he wasn't a detective. He was born a detective.

fields.Title: Variable["inventory.mullen_ripped"]
Variable["inventory.mullen_ripped"]
!(Variable["inventory.mullen_ripped"])
You: "I can surmise, can't I? If Mullen g..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I can surmise, can't I? If Mullen goes to jail there wouldn't be like fifty more of these books.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's right. You never will. But t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's right. You never will. But then, isn't that how it is in real life, detective?

fields.Title: Volition: "You're no tiger, though, detective...."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're no tiger, though, detective. You're a man. It's your curse to have to choose.

fields.Title: You: "The taste of a good cigarette."
fields.Dialogue Text: The taste of a good cigarette.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "There are worse things in the world..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There are worse things in the world than the pursuit of chemical pleasures. But there are better things, too...

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What's the matter, detective?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "What's the matter, detective?"

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "Yes, yes. They're out there waiting..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Yes, yes. They're out there waiting for you, just over the next rise, up on Marvel Hill!

fields.Title: You: "I feel like I've read this before...."
fields.Dialogue Text: I feel like I've read this before. (Close the book.)

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You won't find the answers you're l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You won't find the answers you're looking for here, in other words.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Why? There's truly no point. You'll..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why? There's truly no point. You'll never know who did it, because those pages have literally been scattered to the wind.

fields.Title: Variable["tc.harry"]
Variable["tc.harry"]
!(Variable["tc.harry"])
Jump to: [questionhub]
You: "Don't you sass me. Get on with the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Don't you sass me. Get on with the story.

fields.Title: You: "Drugs. You know it's all about the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Drugs. You know it's all about the drugs.

fields.Title: Jump to: [inventory.mullen_ripped]
You: "Start reading."
fields.Dialogue Text: Start reading.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "And not just any dame -- she's trul..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And not just any dame -- she's truly one-in-a-million, a knock-out whose *mind* is as dangerous as her *curves*. But she's got a *secret*.

fields.Title: You: "I want to hear about the politician..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I want to hear about the politician's son.

fields.Title: You: "Can't trust a dame. (Shake your hea..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Can't trust a dame. (Shake your head.)

fields.Title: You: "No one. Just your own two eyes."
fields.Dialogue Text: No one. Just your own two eyes.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "That's exactly what Dick Mullen say..."
fields.Dialogue Text: That's exactly what Dick Mullen says in "The Dame Who Did It."

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "You begin furiously flipping throug..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You begin furiously flipping through pages. Even as you know these books follow a series of well-worn tropes, you find yourself completely engrossed. You're turning pages so fast you don't even notice the ancient spine coming unglued...

fields.Title: You: "You're right. I should just quit. (..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're right. I should just quit. (Close the book.)

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "Last year, more than 71% of murders..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Last year, more than 71% of murders in Revachol went unsolved. In Revachol West, that number was closer to 85%.

fields.Title: Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Did you lose them? Or did they leav..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Did you lose them? Or did they leave you? Do you even know the difference?

fields.Title: Jump to: [questionhub]
Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity: "Secrets are the currency of human r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Secrets are the currency of human relations.
